page.title: 06Housing.
page.content: The majority of Rochdalians live in privately-owned houses,which are predominantly terraced dwellings.Many of these houses date back to the turn of the century.However,withe help of local authority grants,extensive modernisation has taken place.Also,Urban-renewal projects have been launched in the area in the last decade and these have,and are continuing to transform the image of local housing.Thoughtful demolition is creating more open spaces,which are being tastefully landscaped,and the oppressive,tightly-packed terraced streets are gradually becoming a thing of the past. About one-tenth of the local population currently occupy council
